name: IS4 - Working Near Electrical Hazards
intro: This questionnaire verifies your knowledge of the safety procedures for incidents involving electrical hazards as defined in NCI 12 and the EEA Guide to Electrical Network Safety.

structure.description: Which of these risks may need to be considered when working near electrical hazards?
options: Rescues in or around live electrical hazards
Ground level transformers, switch gear and kiosks
Pole fires, substation fires and explosions
correctAnswer: Rescues in or around live electrical hazards
Ground level transformers, switch gear and kiosks
Pole fires, substation fires and explosions

structure.description: Which of these hazards are associated with working near electricity?
All personnel should be trained in the risks to be encountered and safe practices when working with electrical hazards and crew(s) briefed on plan of action and safety measures.
Electricity supply should NOT be isolated when crew are working nearby.
Treat all equipment/installations as live until certified as not live by power company engineer and only carry out rescues only with full agreement of power company engineer.
If an electrical storm is imminent, withdraw to a safe distance from transmission structures to avoid lightning strikes.
FENZ ladders and other long equipment are safe to use alongside electrical equipment or overhead lines.
The OIC should carry out which control measures?
options: Contact and liaise with power company representatives
Keep personnel directly involved to a minimum
Ensure that crews work together within a 4m cordon of the electric equipment.
Ensure that crews wear full PPE and BA.
Direct deliveries onto electrical equipment at the earliest opportunity.
correctAnswer: Contact and liaise with power company representatives
Keep personnel directly involved to a minimum
Ensure that crews wear full PPE and BA.

structure.description: All personnel should be trained in safe manual handling techniques.
